subject: Re: [junit] Junit result files
msgSnippet: Yes, testRunFinished: http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/org/junit/runner/notification/RunListener.html Good luck, David Saff
messageBody:
Yes, testRunFinished:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/org/junit/runner/notification/RunListener.html

Good luck,

David Saff

On Fri, Oct 8, 2010 at 4:39 PM, Dinesh :) <spdinu@...> wrote:
> Thanks David,
>
> Thanks for your quick response.I have one more query.
>
> Is there any Junit event I can wait for to know if my test is comleted and my result files are ready.
>
> I need this info as I initiate the Junit testÂ from my framework and I am waiting for the Junit test completion(and for results)
>
> Regards,
> Dinesh.
>
> --- On Sat, 10/9/10, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
>
> From: David Saff <david@...>
> Subject: Re: [junit] Junit result files
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Saturday, October 9, 2010, 1:49 AM
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Dinesh,
>
> There are no output files automatically written. However, I believe
> there is a UI option to write out a test result set.
>
> David Saff
>
> On Fri, Oct 8, 2010 at 3:58 PM, Dinesh :) <spdinu@...> wrote:
>> Hi Junit users,
>>
>> I am trying to integrate junit to our own proprietary test framework.
>>
>> Would like to know if Junit result files(xml files) are written/copied into any folders in a windows machine, where I run my eclipse.
>>
>> This would definetly help my task.
>>
>> Thanks a lot in advacne.
>>
>> Regards,
>> Dinesh
>>
>>
